Description: Body sherd (mended from four fragments) of Attic black-figured pottery lip-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: black at offset of rim; handle zone reserved with part of black-figure vertical handle palmette; lower wall black with a reserbed band; inscription in handle zone; ancient repair hole.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1888,0601.243 and belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1888, 0601.439.c.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.12)
Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 67, no. 853, pl. XXII, no. 853)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 416-7, no. B645) (Incorrectly labels the sherd 1888,0601.439.b-c)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0570) (Phase 1)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 693, no. 501)
Smith C 1888 / Acquisitions of British Museum (p. 234, no. 20)
